maml:description.maml:para: Add step to job.
Add step to job.
The subsystem used by the SQL Server Agent service to execute command.
The commands to be executed by SQLServerAgent service through subsystem.
The value returned by a CmdExec subsystem command to indicate that command executed successfully. Dynamic parameter optional when AgentSubSystem is CmdExec.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The name of the database in which to execute a Transact-SQL step. Dynamic parameter is required when AgentSubSystem is AnalysisQuery or TransactSql.
Specifies the name of the user account to use when executing a Transact-SQL step. Dynamic parameter required when AgentSubSystem is TransactSql.
The name of the job to which to add the step.
Is an option that controls behavior.
Specifies name of job step.
The ID of the step in this job to execute if the step fails. Dynamic parameter required when OnFailureAction is GoToStep.
The action to perform if the step fails.
The action to perform if the step succeeds.
The ID of the step in this job to execute if the step succeeds. Dynamic parameter required when OnSuccessAction is GoToStep.
The name of the file in which the output of this step is saved.
The name of the proxy that the job step runs as. Dynamic parameter required when when AgentSubSystem is CmdExec, PowerShell, or Ssis.
The number of retry attempts to use if this step fails.
The amount of time in minutes between retry attempts.
The Analysis Server. Dynamic parameter required when agent subsystem is AnalysisCommand or AnalysisQuery.
SQL Server host name and instance name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a SQL Agent Job object for each job that is present in the target instance of SQL Agent.

The Get-SmoSqlAgentJob function gets a SQL Agent Job object for each job that is present in the target instance of SQL Agent. If the name of the job is provided, the function gets only this specific job object.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a agent alert.
Creates a agent alert.
Specifies the name of alert.
The type of alert condition.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The database in which the error must occur for the alert to fire. Dynamic parameter available when AlertType is SqlServerEvent.
The wait period, in seconds, between responses to the alert.

The sequence of characters that the description of the SQL Server error must be like. Transact-SQL LIKE expression pattern-matching characters can be used. Dynamic parameter available when AlertType is SqlServerEvent.
Is whether the description of the SQL Server error should be included as part of the notification message.
Indicates the current status of the alert.
The name of the job to be executed in response to this alert.
The message error number that defines the alert. Dynamic parameter available when AlertType is SqlServerEvent.
Is an optional additional message sent to the operator as part of the e-mail, net send, or pager notification.
SQL Server host name and instance name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a SQL Agent schedule.
Creates a schedule that can be used by any number of jobs.
The date on which execution of a job can stop. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, Weekly.
The date on which execution of a job can begin. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, Weekly.

When FrequencySubDayType is Once, when to start job. When FrequencySubDayType is not Once, when to start daily frequency interval recurrence. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, or Weekly.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies relative interval. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is MonthlyRelative.

The number of weeks or months between the scheduled execution of a job. When FrequencyType is Monthly or MonthlyRelative, it is the number of months it recurs. When FrequencyType is Weekly, it is the number of weeks it reoccurs. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
Specifies the days that a job is executed. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
When FrequencyType is Daily, it is the number of days it recurs.
When FrequencyType is Weekly, it is the sum of weekly values.
Weekly Values Sunday 1 Monday 2 Tuesday 4 Wednesday 8 Thursday 16 Friday 32 Saturday 64
When FrequencyType is Monthly, it is the month day number.
When FrequencyType is MonthlyRelative, is the relative values listed.
MonthlyRelative Values Sunday 1 Monday 2 Tuesday 3 Wednesday 4 Thursday 5 Friday 6 Saturday 7 day 8 weekday 9 weekend day 10
A value indicating when a job is to be executed.
Indicates the current status of the schedule.
The name of the schedule.
SQL Server host name and instance name.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The date on which execution of a job can stop. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, Weekly.
When FrequencySubDayType is not Once, when to end daily frequency interval recurrence. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
The date on which execution of a job can begin. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, Weekly.

When FrequencySubDayType is Once, when to start job. When FrequencySubDayType is not Once, when to start daily frequency interval recurrence. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, Onetime, or Weekly.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies relative interval. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is MonthlyRelative.

The number of weeks or months between the scheduled execution of a job. When FrequencyType is Monthly or MonthlyRelative, it is the number of months it recurs. When FrequencyType is Weekly, it is the number of weeks it reoccurs. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
Specifies the days that a job is executed. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
When FrequencyType is Daily, it is the number of days it recurs.
When FrequencyType is Weekly, it is the sum of weekly values.
Weekly Values Sunday 1 Monday 2 Tuesday 4 Wednesday 8 Thursday 16 Friday 32 Saturday 64
When FrequencyType is Monthly, it is the month day number.
When FrequencyType is MonthlyRelative, is the relative values listed.
MonthlyRelative Values Sunday 1 Monday 2 Tuesday 3 Wednesday 4 Thursday 5 Friday 6 Saturday 7 day 8 weekday 9 weekend day 10
Daily frequency when FrequencySubDayType is not Once. Dynamic parameter available when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
The sub day type. Dynamic parameter required when FrequencyType is Daily, Monthly, MonthlyRelative, or Weekly.
A value indicating when a job is to be executed.

maml:introduction.maml:para: Creates a schedule to execute once at 15:00:00 on 2022-12-20.
Creates a schedule to execute when SQL Server Agent Starts.
Creates a schedule to execute when CPU becomes idle.
Creates a schedule that executes daily every 15 minute(s) between 12:00:00 AM and 11:59:59 PM.
Creates a schedule that executes once daily at 10:00:00.
Creates a schedule that executes each week on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at 04:00:00.
Creates a schedule that executes the first Tuesday of every 2 months.
